create_optical.gui.hologram_source.title: Hologram Source
create_optical.ponder.opticals.base.head: Transmitting Rotational Force with Light
create_optical.ponder.opticals.base.text: Optical sources transform rotational force into light
Optical receptors can transform the received light into rotational force
Tinted glass, non-transparent blocks and entities can block the light
create_optical.ponder.opticals.beam_focu: Optical focuser can process items with incident light and rotational power
This component needs a incident beam to work properly, you'll need to control the beam type of the source to process certain items
Some recipes need specific items to operate with the required mode
create_optical.ponder.opticals.beam_type: Optical sources can propagate different types of light depending on the given rotational force
Higher the frequency, lower the range of the beam.
Caution with higher frequencies, entities can be hurt by the beam.
create_optical.ponder.opticals.condenser: Optical Condensers can combine up to three beams simultaneously.
This is a heavy optical receptor. It works more like the light receptor but this one supports greater intensities.
The resultant beam acts exactly like a normal beam. But its initial properties follow these criteria:
Intensity is the sum of the beams intensities,
Beam Type and speed direction is the same of the higher beam,
Visibility depends if there's at least one visible beam composing it,
Composing system means that the components can compose a different result than itself. Combining different polarizations create a beam with random polarization.
The color of the beam is the sum of the color of the visible beams.
To transform really fast beams into rotational force you'll need a greater receptor
create_optical.ponder.opticals.hologram_: These hologram sources require visible light to work properly
Right clicking with an item displays it as a hologram
You can color the hologram by coloring the incident beam.
You can access the panel by right clicking it with no items in hand. There you can control the rotation of the hologram.
Hologram sources can be combined in a connection to make the hologram bigger!
create_optical.ponder.opticals.mirror.te: Encased mirrors can propagate the incident beam perpendicularly.
You can rotate it to make the beam propagate wherever you want
create_optical.ponder.opticals.polarizin: Polarizing Beam Splitter blocks can split the beam in two polarized beams.
One of them will propagate straight and be vertically polarized.
The other one of them will propagate perpendicularly and be horizontally polarized.
Propagated beams have certain properties. One of them, is the polarization.
This receptor is receiving a randomly polarized beam. This means that the beam is not oscillating in a preferred direction.
Polarizing filters can change the polarization of the beam and its intensity.
Regardless of the direction of polarization, if the ray is randomly polarized it will always reduce its intensity by half.
You can combine polarizing filters to get your desired intensity. Keep in mind that polarizing a beam perpendicularly will nullify its intensity.
The initial polarization can be configured in the source panel.
create_optical.ponder.opticals.receptors: Right clicking with Optical Devices on a face of receptor adds a sensor to that direction.
Faces with sensor can receive beams.
This is a light receptor. Adding more beams makes the speed of the receptor increase.
This is a heavy receptor. Adding more beams makes the stress capacity of the receptor increase.
With this receptor you can create stress sources very distant from the contraption.
create_optical.ponder.opticals.sensor.te: Optical sensors emits redstone signal if a beam hits it.
You can change the criteria of the redstone level mapping by shift + right click.
The intensity mode makes a reduction based on the intensity of the incident beam.
The color mode maps a specific color to an specific color.
The digital mode make the block full signal if there is a beam incident, if it don't have, then zero redstone signal.
The block also absorb the color of the beam and produces light.
create_optical.ponder.opticals.thermal_s: Thermal Optical sources require a fluid to emmit a beam
Once filled with some fluid these sources begin to emmit light.
Unlike normal sources, these have double kinetic stress impact
Lava grants double intensity comparing to water.
If you want to transport big stress capacity, there is the way you can do it.
create_optical.ponder.tag.opticals.descr: Components which work with optical beams.
death.attack.create_optical.gamma_ray: %1$s received a high dose of gamma rays
